final_answer:
The humor in this image comes from the contrast between the two scenarios depicted side by side, highlighted by the text "YES, BUT."

On the left, a simplified stick figure is happily playing a game on a portable device, seemingly unaffected and content. This represents a carefree and enjoyable experience while traveling.

On the right, a more realistic-looking person is frustrated while holding a device, shown by their expression and body language. The airplane window displays a sign saying "NO INTERNET, THIS GAME DOES NOT WORK WITHOUT INTERNET." This highlights the modern-day frustration many travelers face with technology, especially when games or apps require an internet connection that isn't available on a plane.

The humor lies in the juxtaposition of the simple, seemingly better experience of the past, where games didn't need an internet connection, against the current, often frustrating reality of connectivity issues during travel. This contrast creates a satirical commentary on how technology can complicate our lives.
